article.p: Welcome to the gamelab, a new web application for online (mobile and desktop) game theory experimentation. Gamelab allows experimenters to configure two-player normal-form games for time-based play by a pool of participants. Participants accumulate tickets via their payoffs against the average play. At the end of the experiment, their tickets are used in a lottery drawing to select winners.

Gamelab was developed for Jörgen Weibull with financial support from the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Research Foundation. The project design was guided by Eskil Forsell and implemented by Kristaps Dzonsons.

section.p: We're not releasing the gamelab sources to the public yet—it's just not quite there yet, though well on its way. If you're interested in teaming up, contact Jörgen, Kristaps, or Eskil. The software ships as ISO C source code, compiling and installing on any modern UNIX systems (tested on modern Mac OS X, Linux, and OpenBSD). It requires kcgi, SQLite, and libcurl to compile and run. For installation details, the source contains a comprehensive README file. In the spirit of academic sharing, it is open source ISC licensed, though we kindly suggest that experimenters cite our work.
